THE J. G. WHITE ENGINEERING CORPORATION ENGINEERS AND CONSTRUCTORS 8 O BROAD STREET NEW YORK 4, N. Y.
本件保存
FIELD OFFICE TAIPEI, TAIWAN. P. O. BOX NO. 23 TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS WHITENGECO, TAIPEI.
TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS WHITENGECO, NEW YORK
April 25, 1962 File Ref. MSA-33.4
Mr. C. C. Chang, Chief Second Division Council for United States Aid Taipei, Taiwan
Subject: Excess Equipment
Project No, 84-99-471
Dear Mr. Chang:
With reference to your router dated 22 April covering Shipments Nos. 214,216 and 218, the following allocations are based on original purchase requests.
Shipment # 214 Truck, Dump, 15 ton Mack Model LR (Each 1)
PO E61-029
SDC 9-30-61
+G.1-2.213.82
Shipment # 216
Truck, Cargo, IHC 3 ton, 4 x 2 PO E61-006
(Each 2)
PWB 7-10-61
Shipment # 216 Roller Road, Austin-Western 10 ton (Each 1)
This item covered by PO 60-225, which was for miscl. non-allocated equipment. Mr. Kelly of MKA advises that this item is needed for STC. White Engineering have no recipients with a desire for this item of equipment and suggest that if CUSA wishes, this be allocated to SLC.
健 s It is further understood from Mr. Kelly that he has also requested the two (2) 3-ton IHC Cargo Trucks on this shipment. These under FO E61-006, which was issued after a bona-fide request from PWB, July 10, 1961. White Engineering believes the only correct allocation for these two (2) units would be to PWD.
51.4. 26 08179
V.O.
S.G.
2
494
CUSA

FIELD OFFICE TAIPEI, TAIWAN. P. O. BOX NO. 23 TELEGRAPHIC ADDRESS WHITENGECO, TAIPEI.
Mr. C. C. Chang, Chief Second Division Council for United States Aid Taipei, Taiwan
With reference to your router dated 22 April covering Shipments Nos. 214,216 and 218, the following allocations are based on original purchase requests.
Shipment # 214 Truck, Dump, 15 ton Mack Model LR (Each 1)
Truck, Cargo, IHC 3 ton, 4 x 2 PO E61-006

This item covered by PO 60-225, which was for miscl. non-allocated equipment. Mr. Kelly of MKA advises that this item is needed for STC. White Engineering have no recipients with a desire for this item of equipment and suggest that if CUSA wishes, this be allocated to SLC.

健 s It is further understood from Mr. Kelly that he has also requested the two (2) 3-ton IHC Cargo Trucks on this shipment. These under FO E61-006, which was issued after a bona-fide request from PWB, July 10, 1961. White Engineering believes the only correct allocation for these two (2) units would be to PWD.
